Noun: a social class comprising those who do manual labor or work for wages
productive work (especially physical work done for wage)
concluding state of pregnancy; from the onset of contractions to the birth of a child
an organized attempt by workers to improve their status by united action (particularly via labor union)
a political party formed in Great Britain in 1900; characterized by the promotion of labor's interests and formerly the socialization of key industries
the federal department responsible for promoting the working conditions of wage earners in the United States; created in 1913
any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted
Verb: strive and make an effort to reach a goal
